jrobots.simulation.simulationObjects.launchables

Class Launchable

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrobots.simulation.simulationObjects.launchables.Launchable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bullet, Minethrower, MiniMissile, Missile, Projectile, Rocket

    public abstract class Launchable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Bullets suit the sneaks. They serve you runners.
    But those runaways, beware! They serve you well.

    Launchables move along the direction they were launched. They are moved internally by motion targets. They may collide with panzers.

    Relevant aspects:

    • Launchables' deployment:
      • individual reload time
      • common: initial direction
    • Motion:
      • individual flight physics
      • individual targetting scheme
      • probably individual routines for aftertouch (-> Missile)
      • individual smoke trail parameters
    • Detonation:
      • individual triggering mechanism:
        • contact driven (-> Projectile)
        • location driven (-> mortar, Missile)
      • individual explosion generation
    • Explosion:
      • explosion animation (being gaudy) (individual?)
      • individual explosion radius (area effect)
      • damage dispersion
        (in relation to distance / trigger focused)
      • force dispersion (in relation to distance)
    • Alteration
      • decomposition after certain time (without animation)
    Since:
    2009
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • applyMotionTarget

        public void applyMotionTarget(MotionTargetLaunchable target)
        Applies a motion target, changing the state of the Projectile.

        May be overridden (as to generate smoke). A call to super is obligatory.

        Parameters:
        target - state to set

      • calculateMotion

        public MotionTargetLaunchable calculateMotion(SimulationState state,
                                              double elapsedTime)
        Calculates a target of movement. The state is not changed by this method.

        May be overridden to change the velocity. A call to super is obligatory at the end of the overriding method.

        Parameters:
        state -
        elapsedTime - >= 0
        Returns:
        a MotionTargetProjectile representing the position after the given elapsed timeInFrame

      • clone

        public abstract Launchable clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a new Launchable with identical state (deep copy).

      • DAMAGE_FRONT

        public abstract double DAMAGE_FRONT()
        Damage the Launchable exerts to a Panzer if hitting a given side directly. Note that this routine is only called on colliding Launchables. For the others, it is irrelevant.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • DAMAGE_REAR

        public abstract double DAMAGE_REAR()
        Damage the Launchable exerts to a Panzer if hitting a given side directly. Note that this routine is only called on colliding Launchables. For the others, it is irrelevant.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • DAMAGE_SIDE

        public abstract double DAMAGE_SIDE()
        Damage the Launchable exerts to a Panzer if hitting a given side directly. Note that this routine is only called on colliding Launchables. For the others, it is irrelevant.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • detonate

        public abstract void detonate()
        Is set on collision with an object (if the Launchable participates in collisions). This marks that the Launchable is removed from the simulation.

        Necessity: Directables need to store the information that they are removed from the simulation, so that the Panzer they originate from can remove its uplink.

      • discoverCollision

        public abstract Collision discoverCollision(MotionTargetLaunchable ownTgt,
                                            MotionTargetPanzer panzerTgt)
        Constructs the Droppable's individual collision with the specified panzer
        Parameters:
        ownTgt -

        public abstract void draw(javax.media.opengl.GL gl,
                          ArenaController arena)
        Draws the object on the given arena.

      • EXPLOSION_SIZE

        public abstract int EXPLOSION_SIZE()
        The size of explosion generated [1..20].

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • FORCE_HIT

        public abstract double FORCE_HIT()
        The impulse induced on target on hit. Note that this routine is only called on colliding Launchables. For the others, it is irrelevant.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • LAUNCHER_REFRACTORY_PERIOD

        public abstract double LAUNCHER_REFRACTORY_PERIOD()
        Time until launcher gear can be reactivated after drop. It is class specific.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • LIFE_TIME

        public abstract double LIFE_TIME()
        Life time [s] of this Launchable. It is class specific.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • MAX_VELOCITY

        public abstract double MAX_VELOCITY()
        Estimated maximum velocity of this Launchable [m/s]. Note that only for self-propelled Launchables this value will be different from MUZZLE_VELOCITY.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • MUZZLE_VELOCITY

        public abstract double MUZZLE_VELOCITY()
        Initial velocity of this Launchable at creation time [m/s].

        Every descendant may have its own value.
